Posts.Content: Hi I was told there was no 'best time' to take it but I take it at night as I will be working shifts when I return. I get major problems regulating my body temperature and night cramps. I was advised to drink a small bottle of tonic water each day and I haven't had cramp since. I also bought a 'chillow' from EBay and haven't woken up drenched in sweat since! Well worth the £18.99 hope this helps xx
Posts.Title: Starting tamoxifen today

Posts.Content: Melly - I was the same!!! Especially as I found out AFTER treatment had finished that I'd had 3 types of cancer - greedy or what?!! I've just started having counselling at our local Cancer Care centre. I just want 'me' back. We've all come so far, it's just hard isn't it? xx
Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: Hi moll I had one out of eight nodes removed that was affected, I've had chemo and rads and still on Herceptin and tamoxifen for 5 years. I haven't had any scans and assumed this was because all the nasties were surgically removed and then as a 'belt and braces' approach with chemo/rads. Hope this helps xx
Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: Hi DebsterK I had 4 Docetaxel with Carboplatin and Herceptin and used a chill cap throughout. I had some hair breakage at the crown and have only realised now it's growing back that I lost a line right around my hairline. Well worth trying - no one realised I was having treatment - although some people find it painful and/or incredibly uncomfortable - wish I could post a pic of my hair 6 months afterwards. Good luck
Posts.Title: Weekly Paclitaxel - hair loss

Posts.Content: I had a left mx in November and enquired about immediate reconstruction but was advised against it in case I needed radiotherapy. I had radiotherapy in May, just saw a plastic surgeon who said my skin on that side isn't suitable for implant reconstruction following the treatment. Hang on is my advice, you're not wonky forever xx
Posts.Title: Immediate versus delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Kath I had major problems with eating during chemo and still do 6 months afterward! I lost 2 stone and haven't put any back on. The smell, texture and taste of food made me feel sick and it's still difficult for me now. I have been sick about 3 times a week since September, my oncologist says this is not related to chemo and suggested I had a endoscopy. I'd ask your onc for advice Regards Lesley
Posts.Title: Weight loss continues after treatment well finished.

Posts.Content: Petrina - your Macmillan nurse should be able to sort counselling for you, I started with the local cancer care centre but am now accessing it through Occupational Health at work. If it just reassures you that you're not losing the plot, it's worth it!  Good luck xx
Posts.Title: feeling sad and angry after having had breast cancer

Posts.Content: Fadima - I was/am exactly the same!!! I just want 'me' back but I'm starting to acknowledge through counselling that I have a new normal. It's infuriating,  no one asked to get cancer, have the treatments and feel rubbish. It took 2014 away from me. But 2015 is MINE!!! The counselling helped me see that it's perfectly normal to feel like this, it's like PTSD, but if you think about it it's all utterly traumatic. But we're still here, if a bit scarred, singed and tired. Xx
